articles.description: “While a global pandemic shuttering schools and businesses feels like new territory, many of our families still bear the scars of the 1918 influenza pandemic...
articles.content:
The diary entries from a woman in southwestern Ohio about farm work and life during the 1918 flu pandemic and World War I have brought her future generations comfort and hope as the nation grapples with the coronavirus pandemic.
No school on account of Spani… [+5250 chars]

articles.title: COVID-19: PGPD temporarily suspends beard policy and issues N95 masks to officers - WJLA
articles.description: Prince George's County Police announced Sunday that it is temporarily suspending its beard policy to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. Every officer in the department has been issued an N95 mask when responding to the calls for service and interacting wi…

articles.author: Tom Wrobleski | wrobleski@siadvance.com
articles.title: Why was the 1918 influenza pandemic so deadly? - SILive.com
articles.description: Medical conditions of the day, plus World War I, were big factors.
articles.content:
STATEN ISLAND, N.Y. Influenza simply isnt supposed to be all that deadly.
But the flu pandemic that broke out in the fall of 1918 killed so many people that overall life expectancy in many places around the world was actually diminished.
When all was said a… [+1084 chars]
